result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake D. Serafin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/As a Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(5).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or combination of both to equal full-time.
Psychological evaluation and comply with any recommendations.

No contact with Audrey Faivre, her residence, or her place of employment.
Any relationship required to have with common child is to be done through court worker or rules of guardianship and to follow that.
Maintain absolute sobriety as to alcohol and controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Participate and complete Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program. 
Comply with any other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections. 
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessment and/or treatment.
Submit to DNA sample.

Pay court costs.  To be paid in full 90 days prior to discharge. 
Pay DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution as determined, if any is determined. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Per restitution order filed 3/29/16:  Restitution is determined to be $0.00.

Defendant Blake D. Serafin in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Blake D. Serafin in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Knaapens states appearances.

Court apologizes for the delay.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, copy of the vicitm impact statement has been given to Defense.

Atty Redfield has witnesses to present today.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, comments of witnesses should be limited to sentencing recommendations, not bashing of the Defendant.

3:36 PM John Richart is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.

3:43 PM Julie Pickett Peltz is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Redfield addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 10 Years
Initial confinement for 5 Years
Extended supervision for 5 Years
Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
No contact with Audrey Faivre, her residence, or her place of employment
Any relationship required to have with common child is to be done through court worker or rules of guardianship and to follow that
Maintain absolute sobriety  as to alcohol and controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances

Psychological evaluation and comply with any recommendations
Comply with any other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments and/or treatment
Pay court costs, to be paid in ful 90 days prior to discharge
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination of both to equal full time
Submit to DNA sample 
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 2 Years
Pay restitution as determined if any is determined
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge  
Jail sentence for a period of 1 Year
350 Days Credit
Huber granted

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 02:30 pm

2:08 p.m. Defendant Blake D. Serafin in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Blake D. Serafin in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Count 1: I/S Sentence: 5 yrs Incarceration and 5 yrs Extended Supervision. - stayed: 36 mo Probation w/conditions stated. Count 4: $500 fine + costs + DNA surcharge. Counts 2, 3, & 5 to be dismissed. Up to Court if wants PSI report.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 & 4 - No contest.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:***PSI REPORT is ordered

Atty Redfield requests bond to be amended.
ADA Knaapen recommends a sig bond to get out of jail and set a hearing to later set wage assignment for a cash bond.
BY THE COURT: Motion to Modify bond is Denied.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
